name: swiftness

the quality of happening quickly or immediately: He was surprised by the swiftness of the move. See
swift
More examplesFewer examplesThe outbreak of foot-and-mouth disease among livestock in Britain earlier this year illustrates the swiftness with which a disease can spread. Yesterday's earthquake hit with such unnerving swiftness that a sunny winter's day turned into chaos.Bayard was a horse of incredible swiftness. The government seems to have been taken by surprise by the swiftness, strength and unanimity of international condemnation.
